alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 28 at 2:49AM PST until January 31 at 10:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. 1 to 3 inches possible between 4000 to 5000 feet. 3 to 7 inches possible above 5000 feet. Wind gusts 30 to 50 mph with peak gusts to 60 mph possible at the windiest desert slope locations. * WHERE...San Diego County Mountains. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will start between 4500 and 5000 feet Sunday, dropping to 3500 to 4000 feet by Monday afternoon. Light snow accumulations possible on I-8 in eastern San Diego County.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
